snippet: A match struck to test a Bunsen burner sparked a gas explosion on Thursday in Marble Hill that injured three construction workers, the authorities said.
abstract: Newly renovated science lab at John F Kennedy High School in Manhattan is destroyed in explosion when construction worker, unaware of gas leak, attempts to light Bunsen burner; building is badly damaged, prohibiting students from returning to classes when school resumes on Sept 9.

byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and JOHN SURICO
byline.contributor: Al Baker and Elizabeth A. Harris contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A match struck to test a Bunsen burner sparked a gas explosion on Thursday in Marble Hill that injured three construction workers, the authorities said.

headline.main: Match Lit at Manhattan School Exploded a Laboratory in Renovation
headline.print_headline: Bunsen Burner Test Set Off Explosion in High School Lab, Officials Say

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Kennedy, John F, High School (Manhattan, NY)
